quest.name: Wheels of Justice
journal: Stephanivien seems in a cheerful mood.

Stephanivien welcomes you back to the manufactory, but his cheerful mood is soon soured by the arrival of a Temple Knight. It would seem that the chief machinist has been accused of fomenting insurrection, and a failure to clear this suspicion may result in the seizure of the workshop and imprisonment for its employees. Speak with Stephanivien, and discuss this ominous development.

Reasoning that an attempt to disprove his own actions would be fruitless, Stephanivien decides to counter the accusation by providing evidence of Tedalgrinche's wrongdoing. Head to the Forgotten Knight, and join Celestaux in his search for strings that would connect House Dzemael to their crimes.

Celestaux tells you of the sudden absence of Fraideoux─the man who stood guard over Joye's abducted father─and explains how his suspicions led him to investigate the novice machinist's abode. Amidst the splinters of broken furniture, it seems he discovered the ragged feather of a wild chocobo. Take the tale back to Stephanivien, and plan your next move.
You relay Celestaux's discovery to Stephanivien, and he decides to follow the lead to the Dravanian forelands. Make your way to Tailfeather, and speak with the chief machinist once more.

You join Stephanivien and Joye in Tailfeather. The chief machinist has already questioned the local hunters, and learned that a man matching Fraideoux's description was seen in the company of a rough-looking trio. Head to your assigned search area to the north of the settlement, and confront any suspicious fellows you find.

You find your quarry in a secluded corner of the forest, but are attacked the instant you approach. The ruffians, however, are no match for your effortless marksmanship. Holster your firearm, and rescue Fraideoux from his bonds.

Stephanivien and Joye appear at the scene of the rescue, and Fraideoux begs forgiveness for his unwilling betrayal. The chief machinist waves away the apology, and instead seizes upon the opportunity to turn the tables on his accuser. Return to the Skysteel Manufactory and speak with Stephanivien.

You arrive back at the manufactory to find that Stephanivien has, with the aid of Fraideoux's testimony, lodged a counter-accusation against Tedalgrinche. Practice your new machinist technique whilst you wait for the wheels of justice to slowly grind the suspicions against the workshop into dust.

※The next machinist quest will be available from Stephanivien upon reaching level 58.
objectives: Meet Celestaux in the Forgotten Knight.
Confront the suspicious fellow north of Tailfeather.
Speak with Stephanivien at the Skysteel Manufactory.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Greetings, Forename! Is this not a wonderful day to be a machinist?

dialogue.name: KISHI01708
dialogue.text: (-Stern Voice-)Lord Stephanivien de Haillenarte! You and the Skysteel Manufactory employees under your authority are hereby charged with fomenting insurrection!

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Insurrection!? My dear ser, I have fomented nothing of the sort!

dialogue.name: KISHI01708
dialogue.text: You stand accused of arming commoners with weapons of war, and discharging said weapons within the locality of the Brume.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Ah... That little scene when we liberated Joye's father...

dialogue.name: KISHI01708
dialogue.text: Henceforth, the manufactory shall remain under Temple Knight surveillance─should you fail to refute the accusations against you within the allotted time, punishment may include seizure of your workshop...and imprisonment for all those deemed accomplices to the crime.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: The Fury take that smirking fox! Tedalgrinche knew we would attempt a rescue!

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: Once they set their sights on summat, them Temple Knights is like a bandersnatch with a bone. Ye'd best say farewell to yer workshop.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: They'll not take my manufactory! I will think of something...

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: Once they set their sights on summat, them Temple Knights is like a bandersnatch with a bone. Best say farewell to the workshop.

dialogue.name: JOYE
dialogue.text: How could they have twisted me dad's rescue into an act of insurrection!?

dialogue.name: CELESTAUX
dialogue.text: That Tedalgrinche bastard's always two steps ahead...

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: 'Tis difficult to prove the truth of something one has not done. Mayhap the wiser course would be to provide evidence of Tedalgrinche's wrongdoing.

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: 'E's a clever bastard, though, that one. Ye might try─ Ah, but I'd best not overstep me bounds.

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: Me contract's almost done in any case, and I'll be movin' on no matter what 'appens to the workshop.

dialogue.name: CELESTAUX
dialogue.text: Our instructor, he sure don't like to get involved... As for me, I'll see if I can find any strings connectin' House Dzemael to their crimes. The Forgotten Knight should be a good place to start.

dialogue.name: JOYE
dialogue.text: I don't know what I'd do without the workshop! I'll see if I can't get some folks talkin'!

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: And that leaves you and me, Forename. I believe I shall remain here in the manufactory to occupy the gaze of the Temple Knights, whilst you aid Celestaux with his inquiries.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: 'Tis difficult to prove the truth of something one has not done. Mayhap the wiser course would be to provide evidence of Tedalgrinche's wrongdoing.

dialogue.name: CELESTAUX
dialogue.text: I appreciate you comin' out, Forename. It's a bit hard plannin' aught in the workshop, what with the Temple Knights eyeballin' our every move. We should be able to talk freely in here, though.

dialogue.name: CELESTAUX
dialogue.text: Do you recall that bloke as was standin' guard over Joye's dad? Aye, “Fraideoux” is his name. He took to marksmanship with a passion, and hadn't missed a single day of trainin'...not until today.

dialogue.name: CELESTAUX
dialogue.text: I got suspicious, of course, and decided to pay a visit to his home. Right away, you could see the door had been kicked in, so I went inside and had me a proper look. That's when I found a ragged feather just lyin' there on the floor amidst the bits of broken furniture.

dialogue.name: CELESTAUX
dialogue.text: If I wanted to keep me hands clean, then maybe I'd hire me some thugs from out of town to do for poor Fraideoux. Thugs what might otherwise make a livin' poachin' wild chocobos.

dialogue.name: CELESTAUX
dialogue.text: I suggest you talk to Lord Stephanivien, and take a trip out to Tailfeather. I'll keep pokin' around here in the city and see what else crawls out of the stonework.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: ...Hmmm, this may be our best lead. If we can track down the man who first employed Fraideoux, then we shall have a solid link to House Dzemael.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Let us waste no time. Onwards to the Dravanian forelands, and to Tailfeather!

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Onwards to the Dravanian forelands, and to Tailfeather!

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Good news, Forename! I have spoken with some few of these hunter fellows, and they told me of a trio of ruffians that passed through here dragging a man matching Fraideoux's description.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: We shall scour the forest to the south, if you will look to the north. Do not wait for us─should you find these ruffians, then pray confront them ere Fraideoux comes to further harm.

dialogue.name: ZOKU01708
dialogue.text: No witnesses! Cut this one's throat as well!

dialogue.name: FRAIDEOUX
dialogue.text: H-How did you find me!?

dialogue.name: FRAIDEOUX
dialogue.text: ...My thanks. I did not expect to see another dawn.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Fraideoux! Not leaking blood, are you? Splendid! You gave us quite a scare!

dialogue.name: FRAIDEOUX
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: FRAIDEOUX
dialogue.text: F-Forgive me, me lord! Those men...they dragged me from me home. Said they'd hurt me if I didn't swear false witness to the Temple Knights...

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: You were forced to substantiate their accusations? Then you merely need withdraw your testimony to strengthen our position. 'Twould be a boon if we were also able to provide some manner of physical evidence...

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: A seal of House Dzemael. 'Twould explain how the ruffians who snatched Fraideoux were able to enter the city without challenge. Aye, this shall do nicely.

dialogue.name: FRAIDEOUX
dialogue.text: I'm truly sorry, me lord. All it took was one little beating for me to repay your kindness with betrayal. I'll not darken your doorstep again...

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: What nonsense! You hardly had a choice in the matter!

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Continue your training at the manufactory, however, and you'll become more than a match for thugs such as these. Even without a noble's wealth or prestige, a common man can earn himself independence!

dialogue.name: JOYE
dialogue.text: You'll see that a machinist's firearm is for more than just shootin' dragons─it can help set you free. His lordship's vision'll change Ishgard for the better!

dialogue.name: JOYE
dialogue.text: Come with us, Fraideoux! Become the spear and the shield that our city needs!

dialogue.name: FRAIDEOUX
dialogue.text: <sob> I-I'd like that... I'd like to feel like I'm worth somethin'...

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: We all make mistakes, my dear fellow. The trick is to learn from them, and rise stronger from every defeat! Come, let us return to the manufactory!

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: The tables have turned, my friend. I have submitted the evidence you found to the Temple Knights.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: With the aid of Fraideoux's new testimony, we had enough proof to lodge a counter-accusation against Tedalgrinche.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: The wheels of justice have begun to turn, and we shall soon be free of these baseless suspicions!

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: In the meantime, Rostnsthal requested that I instruct you to “remember yer bleedin' practice drills!” Charming fellow.

dialogue.name: SYTEM
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）
